content: winter wonder cowl created by misty thornton south dakota crochet creations overview i ve seen so many of these around and just knew i needed to make one the problem i always seemed to come across was that i don t love a point on the back of my hood and they also seemed to have a tighter fit than i would like so after looking at a few of them up close i attempted to create something that fit exactly what i was looking for as a bonus i created a matching pair of mittens to go with it i won t ever charge for this pattern because i am not so original to think i thought all of this up on my own someone came up with the original idea and that certainly wasn t me i just made it work for me 1 materials 1 any size 5 weight yarn or double stranded 3 weight yarn i used two colors but one would be beautiful too i think worsted weight could be used but it would be lacier amounts differ by the yarn 2 6mm crochet hook 3 scissors 4 yarn needle pattern notes and special stitches chain 2 at the beginning of each round or row never counts as a stitch fpdc - front post double_crochet bpdc - back post double_crochet decrease - double_crochet two together pattern cowl chain 70 to start slip_stitch into the first chain to form a ring being careful not to twist your chain working in rounds do not turn round 1 chain 2 double_crochet in same stitch as slip_stitch and in each stitch around slip_stitch to the first double_crochet to finish round 70 round 2 chain 2 fpdc bpdc *to last stitch slip_stitch to first fpdc to complete round 70 round 3 - 20 repeat round 2 finish off and weave in the ends 2 hood at this point you will be working in row and turning your work if you are making your hood a different color this is the place to change color find the first double_crochet across from your seam approximately 35 stitches from your seam and join your row 1 chain 2 double_crochet in the same stitch and in each stitch around do not join 70 row 2 chain 2 turn double_crochet in the first stitch 2 double_crochet in the next stitch double_crochet in each stitch until 2 stitches are left 2 double_crochet in next stitch double_crochet in the last stitch 72 row 3 chain 2 turn double_crochet in each stitch across 72 row 4 - 12 repeat row 2 and 3 ending with a row two and a total of 82 stitches row 13 - 22 chain 2 turn double_crochet in each stitch across 82 row 23 chain 2 turn double_crochet in next 31 stitches decrease*10 double_crochet in remaining 31 stitches 72 row 24 chain 2 turn 26 double_crochet decrease*10 double_crochet in remaining 26 stitches 62 row 25 chain 2 turn 21 double_crochet decrease*10 double_crochet in
